result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David R Angst in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for David R Angst.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant David R Angst in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for David R Angst.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to a Reserve Judge, Branch 13. All parties are notified that effective October 31st, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37, in Room 508 of the Courthouse. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
